intro: Rubus hallandicus, commonly known as the Halland raspberry, is a species of bramble native to northern Europe. It is characterized by its thorny stems and compound leaves with serrated edges. The plant produces small, aggregate fruits that are typically red or yellow in color. It thrives in moist, shady environments such as woodlands and stream banks. Botanically, it belongs to the Rosaceae family and is closely related to other raspberry and blackberry species.
